arm_group.description: Teachers from Intervention schools will receive ParentCorps training and support.
Teachers from control schools will not receive training and support in Year 1, but will receive training and support in Year 2.

brief_summary.textblock:
Implementation of an adapted ParentCorps program in Ugandan schools will improve school
      mental health service resources, teachers' knowledge about child mental health, and
      teachers' classroom behavioral management and parent involvement skills.

clinical_study.brief_title: School-Based Mental Health Program Implementation in Uganda
condition: Teacher Skills in Addressing Child Mental Health Problem

detailed_description.textblock:
Participating schools are randomly assigned to a 6-month long school-based intervention or
      to a wait-list control group. The intervention focuses on improving teacher's classroom
      behavioral management practices, parent engagement, and child mental health knowledge.

      Teachers are assessed at the beginning and the end of the study, and again after 6 months of
      intervention. Teachers' parent engagement, mental health knowledge, and behavioral practices
      in the classroom are assessed through observations and teacher ratings.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Early childhood teachers

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Not early childhood teachers

clinical_study.official_title: Implementing a School-based Mental Health Prevention Program in Ugandan Schools

authority: United States: New York University School of Medicine

primary_outcome.description: Teacher classroom behavioral management skills and parent engagement practices will be measured
primary_outcome.time_frame: Outcome will be measured 3 times--before interveniton, after intervention (about 6 month after the baseline assessment), and 6-month post intervention (about 6 months after the 2nd evaluation)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: New York University School of Medicine

clinical_study.source: New York University School of Medicine

lead_sponsor.agency: New York University School of Medicine

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention
